title.rendered: Need for single rate GST, exemption-less taxation: EAC-PM Chairman Bibek Debroy

content.rendered:
Economic Advisory Council to the Prime Minister (EAC-PM)Chairman Bibek Debroy on Monday stated that India should have a GST with a single rate and a taxation system without exemptions. Despite a far higher need for government spending on public infrastructure, he claimed that the total tax revenue of the central government and the states is just 15% of GDP.

“On GST, it is my submission, therefore, there should be a single rate. I don’t think we will ever get it…,” Debroy said at an e ..
As a polity, we need to recognise that the GST really should be the same regardless of the product. If progressivity is to be introduced, it is best done by direct taxes, not GST, or indirect taxes,” Debroy noted.

Debroy also clarified that his speech should not be construed as a recommendation of the PMEAC.
